attribute-definition.description: Flag that indicates wether or not the taxes have been successfully calculated.
Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses demandware content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal urls http://xchange.demandware.com

Used to define the content asset used to populate a grid page banner for a category. This value is applied to all sub category navigation (cascading) if no specific catBannerID has been defined for a sub category.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Indicates whether a category should be displayed on the homepage gridwall

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll over navigation.
In order to show in mobile nav the category needs to have both showInMenu and this attribute set to true

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.
Image used on either the top or bottom slot on the category landing pages.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this content asset.
The number of items returned by this customer
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

attribute-definition.display-name: Is this order exported as Employee Order to Nike

attribute-definition.description: Flag that indicates wether or not the taxes have been successfully calculated.
Flag that indicates order item(s) were updated with new status
Flag that indicates order item(s) status is ready to be emailed to the customer

attribute-definition.display-name: Device used to place the order
Indicates whether or not any errors have happened while processing the request using this particular payment instrument

Regular or DYO
Regular or DYO
A flag indicating if this profile should be deleted. Once set to true a user can't use this profile to login. The actual deletion is performed by a corresponding batch process.
A flag indicating if this profile was deleted by a user. Once set to true a user can't use this profile to login anymore. The actual deletion is performed by a corresponding batch process.
A flag indicating that profile has Rubber Tracks data attached to it
A flag indicating that this customer has been imported from old system
Customer No of the employee this customer is related to
A flag indicating that profile has been created through Rubber Tracks

value-definition.display: Can be combined with any promotion
Cannot be combined with promotions of same class
Cannot be combined with any promotion

attribute-definition.description: Determines if activity feed modules added to the site will be rendered.
Specify the name of your site. This string will be planted into various headers of the activity feed plugin.
API Key used to identify the Gigya user account
Determines if comments modules added to the site will be rendered.
Specifies whether comments will be shared with the activity feed.

The identifier of the Comments Category with which this plugin is associated. Before embedding a Comments plugin in your site, you are required to create at least one comment category in the Comments Setup page on Gigya's website.
The message that will show up in the feed to describe the user action when sharing an order.
The message that will show up in the activity feed to describe the user action when sharing a product.
Determines if follow modules added to the site will be rendered. The follow buttons are configured using the gigya_followAction custom object.
The size of the icons displayed in the follow bar
Sets the arrangement of buttons in the bar
Determines if game mechanics modules added to the site will be rendered.
The total number of users to display in the Leaderboard plugin.
The period for which to display the Leaderboard plugin
Determines if game notifications are active.
The language of Gigya's user interface and error messages
Specifies the size of the login buttons
Determines whether login header modules will render

A list of providers that should be displayed on the header login module. Additional login providers can be added by editing this system preference field in the "Site Development" section of the Demandware Business Manager.
Specifies the width of the Header Login Control.

A list of providers that should be displayed on the login module. Additional login providers can be added by editing this system preference field in the "Site Development" section of the Demandware Business Manager.
The privacy level determines how the user action is presented in each of the Activity Feed plugin tabs
Synchronize Gigya product ratings with Demandware site.
Determines if ratings modules added to the site will be rendered.
Specifies whether ratings get sent to the activity feed

The default identifier of the Ratings Category with which this plugin is associated. Before embedding a Ratings plugin in your site, you are required to create at least one category in the Comments Setup page on Gigya's website.
Determines if reaction modules added to the site will be rendered. The reaction types can be configured using the gigya_reactionType custom object.
Specifies whether reactions should be sent to the activity feed.
Determines whether the user is permitted to click on multiple reaction buttons on the same reaction bar, or click on one reaction button only
Determines if and where to display the share counts in relation to the reaction button
This parameter determines the type of the counter
Sets the horizontal or vertical arrangement of buttons in the bar.
Key given to use as a security measure between site and Gigya
Specifies whether the share modules share to the activity feed.
Determines whether to show the "Always Share" check-box on the order share module
Determines whether to enable the "Never Share" option on the order share module.

Providers that will be displayed when sharing an order or product. Additional providers can be added by editing this system preference field in the "Site Development" section of the Demandware Business Manager.

Using this parameter you may determine whether to use Gigya's URL shortening service for URLs, which are published through this method. This includes URLs inserted by the user as part of their edited text message. When Gigya's URL shortening service is active, Gigya tracks all the traffic coming from the distributed URLs. In such cases, 'Referred Traffic' reports will be available to you.
Determines if share bar modules added to the site will be rendered.

A list representing the buttons to display in the share bar. Additional options can be added by editing this system preference field in the "Site Development" section of the Demandware Business Manager.
This parameter determines whether the share bar buttons are displayed as icons only, without text and borders.
Sets the arrangement of buttons in the bar
Determines if share order modules added to the site will be rendered.
Determines if share product modules added to the site will be rendered.
Determines if Login and Registration modules added to the site will be rendered.
Enable plug & play analytics integration solution for Google Analytics.
